Specific Authorization Required to Disclose Records Protected by 38 U.S.C. 7332
The claimant must specifically authorize consent VA to disclose records to the claimant's representative that relate to conditions protected under the provisions of
38 U.S.C. 7332
, namely
drug abuse
alcoholism or alcohol abuse
infection with the human immunodeficiency virus, or
sickle cell anemia.
The claimant may
authorize disclosure of all protected records, or
limit
disclosure to
one or more
categories of protected records.
Reference
:  For more information on the relationship between
38 U.S.C. 7332
authorization and access to VA electronic system access to claims folder materials, see
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 2.B.2.g
.
title: M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section B - A Representative’s Right to Notification and Review of Records
